pullrequest.title: Clean up some unnecessary stderr output

content.raw:
I believe using $\(MAKE\), it's telling the top-level make to spawn sub-makes, whereas the `${CMAKE_COMMAND} --build` is causing a new top-level make invocation.

This is where my knowledge of make gets a little fuzzy though, so I’ll provide some references:

* [http://cmake.3232098.n2.nabble.com/CMake-3-7-2-and-parallel-builds-td7594960.html](http://cmake.3232098.n2.nabble.com/CMake-3-7-2-and-parallel-builds-td7594960.html)
* [http://cmake.3232098.n2.nabble.com/How-would-I-use-parallel-make-on-ExternalProjects-td5609078.html](http://cmake.3232098.n2.nabble.com/How-would-I-use-parallel-make-on-ExternalProjects-td5609078.html)  

Since it specifically affects makefiles, I made it target only that generator, so Ninja, MSVC, etc should stay the same, and this should remove warnings for makefiles.
content.html:
I believe using $(MAKE), it's telling the top-level make to spawn sub-makes, whereas the ${CMAKE_COMMAND} --build is causing a new top-level make invocation.

This is where my knowledge of make gets a little fuzzy though, so I’ll provide some references:

  • http://cmake.3232098.n2.nabble.com/CMake-3-7-2-and-parallel-builds-td7594960.html
  • http://cmake.3232098.n2.nabble.com/How-would-I-use-parallel-make-on-ExternalProjects-td5609078.html

Since it specifically affects makefiles, I made it target only that generator, so Ninja, MSVC, etc should stay the same, and this should remove warnings for makefiles.
